intro: Columnea macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered flame vine, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a trailing or climbing vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Columnea macrantha is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in containers or as a ground cover in suitable climates.
